title: Title page of Encyclopedie
notes: Acted as an informative publication. Displayed an interest in print production.

title: Josiah Wedgwood
notes: Consistency and Quality. Division of labor. Molds over potters wheel.

title: Eli Whitney
notes: Within two years of the invention production increased by 8 fold. Paved the way for mass production.

title: No. 14 Chair
notes: 36 dismantled chairs could be packed into one quebec meter. Most successful production in the history of industrial mass production.

title: Crystal Palace
notes: Show case art. Optimize, belief in progress, and materialism. World wide representation of manufactures.

title: Trellis wallpaper
notes: Theme of wallpaper was natural. Hand crafted. Long process. Timeless appeal.

title: Smoking Bench
notes: Lively a-semicircle design. Intended to be fulling integrated into the style of the entire house.

title: Adjustable-Back Chair No. 2342
notes: Ideas on simplicity, honesty, and truth. Work was nostalgics on handy-craft and pre-industrial era.

title: Poster for Tropon food concentrate
notes: Experiments with imaginative letter forms. Abstract art. Modulated color. Illustrating in a non-traditional manner. (Pg. 137)

title: Cycles Perfecta
notes: Used organic and flowing forms. Used pastel shades for his painting and fellow motifs and feminine forms.

title: Poster for AEG lightbulbs
notes: A machine aesthetic. Used technical determinism and functionalism.

title: Electric Kettle
notes: Visual unity. Hand hammered. Hexagonal trademark. (Pg. 149)

title: Villa Savoye
notes: Re-use ground under the structure. Color was used functionally to identify different spaces and to set a mood.

title: Clock
notes: Clock references cubism. Uses enamel glass paste.

title: Pivolo Aperitif
notes: Using pictographic images with blocks of text. Symbols appeal to immediacy and signification. (Pg. 172)

title: Model ME1 Table Lamp
notes: Early products made by the Bauhaus. Reflects hand crafted artistry and strict geometric and mathematical forms.

title: Red-Blue Chair
notes: All joint extend beyond the where the right angle meet to accentuate negative space. Back of seat made of plywood.

title: Kombinationsschrift Typeface
notes: Designed while teaching at the Bauhaus. Used geometric forms. Drawn on a grid.

title: Rural Electrification Administration Lighting Poster
notes: Employed characteristics of the New Typography and abstract art. Designs used strong contrast and simplicity to communicate information with little text.

title: Type 300
notes: Switched from metal to lighter way plastic. Placed numbers on outside instead of inside for legibility.

designer: Piet Mondrian and Theo Van Doesburg
title: Cover for De Stijl Vol 4
notes: Mondrian referred to his new conception of art as Neoplasticism or the 'New Plastic'. Balance between the individual and the universal consciousness.

title: Coldspot for Sears
notes: Main point of interest at the Paris international exposition. Stream line design. Improved reliability and serviceability.

title: Arrow Collars Ad
notes: Experiment with Photography and Typography and Layout. Reduce the amount of text in magazine ads.
